website_summaries.verdict: A budget-priced, no-frills machine. The best deal for the least amount of money.
pros: Solid specs yield a satisfactory performance

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Limited Warranty and Flimsy Tines
customer_reviews.text: Tough little guy, the motor is amazing and it's so easy to operate but after about 5 hours of use, one of the teeth broke away working yard soil with some last years tomato roots. They put a beefy motor with flimsy metal, what a shame... UPDATE: The product is still under warranty so I submitted a claim, below is their response; contact@americanlawnmower.com 12:18 PM (8 hours ago) to me Good Afternoon, The tines not under warranty. However, to place an order for the tine set RTC70001SET $33.01 + S&H (all replacement tines included and tine hardware) parts not sold separtely. Thank you,
customer_reviews.author: MissouriMK

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for two seasons then seized up completely
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the tiller when I first bought it in 2016. Used it to till a 16x16 garden. I only used it a few times in the same garden each year and this season it completely seized up on me. I contacted the manufacturer and even sent the attached video and have not heard back. I believe it has a two year warranty and am waiting to hear back on what they want to do. Up until a few days ago this was a 5 star product especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Bought 1 year ago..WON'T run.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in March of 2018. Used it LESS then 45 min. Oil was leaking all over. Manual says don't mess with the oil for 1 year. Tried it today, ran for a few minutes then acted like I hit a rock ( BUT THERE WAS NO ROCK AT ALL ) it quit and I waited 15 minutes to try it. Started and would only run a couple minutes then quit !! I am a single 62 woman. After 45 min, of use it is doing this. Just makes me totally sick!!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry D

customer_reviews.title: Defective.
customer_reviews.text: The starter button and handle appear to be defective. Sometimes is starts after several tries. Very disappointed. I didn't realize the return window was only a month. I got it less 60 days ago, and hadn't tried it today. I guess I will see if the company is any good :( Update~ So far can't get hold of the company. At this point, I don't suggest buying this tiller
customer_reviews.author: Vinity

customer_reviews.title: ZERO power from this thing
customer_reviews.text: We picked this thing up with the sole purpose of mixing in compost and fertilizer into already loose and un-compacted raised bed soil. On average, it would run for approximately 20 - 30 seconds and then trip the overheat shut-off.....in LOOSE SOIL...there were no rocks, tree roots, or compacted soil. Ended up spending more time waiting for the p.o.s. to reset itself than actually tilling. Straight into the dumpster with this one, so frustrated with this thing we didn't even want to bother with this company. Will never spend another dime on any Earthwise products if this is their standard of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Robsquared

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one season
customer_reviews.text: Poor little feller just didn't have the guts to go on after tilling up 200 square feet of soil infused by tiny roots. We usually turn the soil over with shovels, but we are getting old, so we bought a tiller. The axle broke plum in two. I guess that means my heart is stronger than the steel that went into that thing, even though I'm older than the dirt it was tilling when it died.
customer_reviews.author: Middle American Homemaker

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent little Rototiller. I was amazed at how powerful it is. Several people said that the only thing it could cut would be grass roots, well, look at the image, it shows some of the roots that it was able to dig out of our yard. Highly recommended. Unless you have an extremely large area or need to go deeper than 6 to 8 inches I can’t imagine why you would rent a tiller for $70 when you can buy and own this one for about $95. If you rotate the wheels up you can dig even deeper which is what we did when we were planting several potted plants. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Tomasi

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Here's my pro & con: Pro...Good power, light weight...so nice not to have to mess with gas and pull start...easy to operate, but... Con... Probably too powerful for the average woman or elderly man (that's me). Better put the wheels down or it will be hard to control. Too large for most flower beds. But all in all I am very happy. It does the job very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mara Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I didn't get sooner  !! BUT I'M HAPPY NOW!!  ☺😁
customer_reviews.text: Received it today and put it together and used it in short order.It works well for 8.5 amp's , took getting used to AND EFFORT watching out for the electric cord backing up but it's just fine! I like it!!! And it's much easier than my motorized tiller ( bigger path tiller ) I did have to clean the tine's of weeds & vines often but I except that it should BE much easier the next time because there will be less weed. The lower gear box did get quite warm WITH the weed build up in my opinion and I will check ✔ the gear box OIL. I'M happy & weeding is now EASY !. !!! Happy days !!!
customer_reviews.author: John Wik.

customer_reviews.title: the instructions not correct
customer_reviews.text: putting it together was easy.. Once you are done and ready to use...the instructions tell you to press the “A” button then pull down on “B” handle... that ...does not work. oddly enough when I called my neighbor over to help me...he did the opposite and pulled on the “B” handle first and then “A” and it started right up. If it were not for him...I would have had to contact the company and have project delayed. So...Earthwise...revise your instructions and I would heartily suggest you include a note with each product you sell so the consumer does not think the product is damaged in some way since it wont work.
customer_reviews.author: happy girl

customer_reviews.title: Really nice compact cultivator for small-medium projects
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Small, compact, easy on the storage space. Just completed a medium-sized yard project prepping for sod placement. Over the years, the Texas sun had baked my yard to a hard surface and this tiller broke it up surprisingly well. The foam-covered handle was comfortable with little to no annoying vibration on the hands. Tillers were easy to clean by hand...cannot rinse it off as it's electric. Cons: It is electric and your extension cord will be a constant challenge keeping it out of the path of the blades. If you plan on using this often, consider a gas engine model.
customer_reviews.author: detconnection

customer_reviews.title: Gardening Made Easier
customer_reviews.text: We have a tractor till the garden area & then we run the rototiller over the rows, mixing in soil amendments. Compared to those that run on fuel, these are lighter & easier to manage, but the lightweight can have drawbacks because it doesn't go as deep as the fueled machines, but that works well for how I garden. It's not difficult to use with the electric cord, which was a concern. It does take some muscle though & having some physical limitations, I cannot work it as long as I'd like, but I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: Paid for a new rototiller got a returned one
customer_reviews.text: 1 Star is not for the product, it's for the following: Received the rototiller today. Just opened the delivery box and found that someone had already opened the product box. And looks like I was sent an item that was returned. I am not happy. Now the hassle of returning it as I don't want to open it fully, find out there are missing parts, and have to figure out how to put it all back together. A waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Dspring

customer_reviews.title: Good for the cost
customer_reviews.text: This tiller did a nice job on several small garden plots. Because it is light weight it is easy to move around but that also means you really need to be careful and heavy boots is a good idea because it would be really easy to harm your foot with this if you are not careful. All tillers are dangerous but as light as this is pulling it backwards you need to use extra caution. It does not till real deep but its adequate for a home garden and does not require the maintenance that a gas powered tiller does. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Old Boots

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it! So glad not to be shoveling.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for a hobby gardener, lightweight, easy to maneuver , I have attacked many areas with this in just a few days. My shoulders are sore from the workout, but not unduly so. I already have seeds in one area. It grinds in manure/ straw/ leaves and small twigs from a tree well. My chickens also love the soft soil after the area has been plowed.
customer_reviews.author: Degrees

customer_reviews.title: The right power and size for the job
customer_reviews.text: Looked at several electric tillers, decided the 8.5 amps would be better for us given the location of our new raised beds and using extension cords. My daughter did the tilling, no problems She won't mow the grass but she had no problems using this! Plenty of power to till new untilled soil (tilling the beds before we added the new topsoil). She was very proud of the results. Looking forward to using it for a few other tasks, reworking our front and side beds and reseeding a few areas. Good size and weight. Easy to assemble. It was a good decision, very happy with this tiller.
customer_reviews.author: OC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to help loosen the dirt in my hard clay soil. This did great in my flower bed. Only problem, I do have a lot of rocks in a section of my flower where they dumped rocks in building the foundation of my house. A couple times rocks got stuck in the blades. So if you have a rocky soil this may not be for you. Otherwise for me, it did the job for the little section I needed it for. I’m not the strongest person, but it will take off when started, but even I can Maneuver this.
customer_reviews.author: G-Force

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a gas powered tiller and it was constantly needing oil changes, fuel treatments, draining fuel for winter, etc. My neighbor has one like this so I decided to give it a try. This thing is a monster. I have large 10x10 raised bed gardens and this rips thru the soil with ease. I have had zero issues so far. Putting it together took me about 20 minutes total. Simply plug it in and you're off. No gas, no oil, no winterizing, etc. Could not recommend this enough!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Darrin

customer_reviews.title: Did great job  one till it stopped working. **  They have good Customer Service **
customer_reviews.text: I used it couple of times last spring and tried to use it yesterday, the thing wont work. I checked and saw that cables are OK and there is no problem with the Switch. It was stored in clean place inside my Garage. No contact with water or moisture . I tried sending email to the Earthwise but it bounced back. Anyone can advise how to contact the dealer or If Dealer do go through reviews contact me Update: I was able to contact Dealer and they have a wonderful customer service. They promised to replace the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Shree Menon

customer_reviews.title: Best $90 for my garden!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Best $90 I ever spent on my garden. Churned up my rock hard soil and suddenly it doesn’t look so bad quality. Just watered well the night before, tilled the next day. Watered well again, and tilled a second time the day after and I’ve got rich fluffy soil. It’s a little hard to turn and I prefer going forward for a line, then going over it again backward to get in there deep. After the whole patch is done, I do it again crosswise. Only problem is you have to grip the handle the whole time to keep it running which gets tiresome, could be hard for someone older or with arthritis.
customer_reviews.author: Heather S

customer_reviews.title: Made in China not USA, as expected, from the USA Company.
customer_reviews.text: After Reading all literature about this tiller I purchased it, EXPECTING it to be made in the USA. Yes. The company is a USA company. But after reading the label on the tiller it say's "MADE IN CHINA"!!!! Sending this back to Amazon for a refund! Deceptive advertising!!!
customer_reviews.author: sidoog

customer_reviews.title: Strong machine for soil prep for planting or paving.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is strong and tough. It's not just for preparing soil for planting. I am installing some brick pathways in my yard and this machine breaks up the soil and makes digging to the proper depth much easier than using a mattock and shovel. Tosses small and medium size stones and pieces of gravel right out of the dirt so I can rake them out. Grinds up grass that you don't want to remove and save. Bottom line: this machine makes any soil prep, for planting or paving, much easier and faster than using hand tools. Worth the price to save sweat and time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert in TexasTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Good tiller, average safety features
customer_reviews.text: It tills well, but I don’t like the safety features to run it. There is a button you have to push and a safety handle to grip that are both on the right side. So you have to use your left hand to push the button (which is on the outer right side of ur right hand forcing you to cross hands) while ur right hand then pulls the safety handle. At this point you only have one hand on the main tiller handle which seemed dangerous at times, especially when you’re also trying to hold the cord out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Raihala

customer_reviews.title: EVEN GETS THROUGH MS CLAY SOILS REAL GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is GREAT! I live in Mississippi, so you best believe I was skeptical of this little tiller getting through our tough, clay soil. Boy, was I WRONG! Just make sure it's not bone dry, and let her rip! She tills AMAZINGLY, and really takes a beating! I accidentally left it uncovered in my garden all spring, out in the elements and rain. Yet when I went to get it and see if it still worked, it STILL DOES! ABSOLUTELY A MUST BUY IF YOU'RE LOOKING FOR A SMALL TILLER!
customer_reviews.author: CUMULOCRIS

customer_reviews.title: Great for construction of new raised bed gardens
customer_reviews.text: This tiller was a great tool for me as I built two new 22' X 6' raised beds. It is small enough to pick up and move around while powerful enough to mix up the layers of potting soil, peat moss, and top soil that I applied in lifts to mix up and create a great garden soil. The soil in my yard is largely clay so I had to build a raised bed with purchased soil. I would definitely recommend this tiller for anyone building new beds that are relatively small like mine. Very pleased that my expectations which were raised by the overall positive comments I read about this machine were fully met.
customer_reviews.author: Baton Rouge Guy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!  Works on clay.
customer_reviews.text: After many failed electric items, I had very little hopes and almost no expectations for this. But after our gas tiller breaking EVERY SINGLE winter....it was worth a shot. We have literally 100% clay that is the worst dirt I've ever worked with and we regularly pull up huge rocks because our builder was careless. This thing chewed through clay, large rocks and vines like the commercial grade tiller I've used in the past. Only issue is that it bounces because it's not terribly heavy. But for less that $100, this was an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Frances

customer_reviews.title: Long term 3 years of use review -still awesome
customer_reviews.text: If you want a small tiller for a small vegetable garden then this thing will do the job easily. It rips through my clay soil and digs right down and obviously it will till in manure or potting soil -which I do after an initial tilling. Used properly it will fluff up a good 6 to 8 inches of soil. It has never failed me and the garden grows much better. I suspect this will last a lifetime if stored properly out of the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Atomic Dog

customer_reviews.title: Very poor hardware, instructions poorly organized
customer_reviews.text: I just attempted assembly on this tiller (long after the return window closed-my fault) and got stymied in Step 2-2. Locking pin to keep wheel assembly locked in place would not go into the hole for it. The bolt which kept the two frame members together was just not right size or type for this application. Very poor design (as in cheap) and absolutly no quality control of critical assembly steps. Would not buy this again, but too late for return. Anything Earthwise is off my list.
customer_reviews.author: GrayslakeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very effective!
customer_reviews.text: I finally used the tiller for the first time today. What a great machine. It’s lightweight but very powerful! Entire weed plants flew up out of the ground. It left my garden soil very deeply and finely tilled. Does it buck? Yes! But not as much as my neighbor’s gas tiller. The single handle gave me good control and it was not very noisy compared to gas tillers. Best of all the air the air was not fouled. I love this tiller and highly recommend it to my fellow gardeners. I am a female who does not lift weights or workout, so if I can do it, and I’m 70, you can as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Gottesman

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really have any great expectation, it's an electric tiller. Was I surprised, it went through the compacted soil in my yard with no difficulties. I am beyond thrilled and looking for more things to till up. Will say the cord holder was a pain to get on but once that frustration was overcome it was smooth sailing. Super affordable and super user friendly. I would not hesitate to recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Instantkarma

customer_reviews.title: This machine is incredible and very powerful, perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to reseed my back yard. I had a small area I needed to till and was considering renting a tiller from my local hardware store. I found this machine on Amazon and after reading the reviews I decided to give it a try. I am so happy I did. This machine is incredible and very powerful, perfect for my job. My back yard was packed dirt as hard as a rock and this tool worked flawlessly to prepare my yard fo. I was very impressed how powerful it is and how easy it was to handle. I am very very very happy with this product..a must buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Granny can keep on gardening!
customer_reviews.text: I am 72 years old and in reasonable healthy condition but the old garden tiller I have used for years is just too hard to handle. This Earthwise electric tiller is wonderful! I can keep on gardening. I can lift it into the 8" raised beds and till away with hardly any effort. I was surprised at the power of the little thing. It can chew through the weeds just fine. When I get into a patch of crab grass it is easy to turn the tiller over and untangle the grass from the tines.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Best Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tiller for two years and I am very impressed with the quality. The tiller has been put through some very difficult diggings. Large rocks, roots, even rock hard red clay is no match for this product. Large roots will have to be cut with an axe but still the tiller keeps on going. Not much wear and tear in the tines, they must be made out of some very heavy duty steel. Just love this tiller.
customer_reviews.author: JETLAT7878

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations!
customer_reviews.text: This surprisingly powerful machine tilled my garden in a matter of minutes. Granted my garden is only 5'x15', but could do a larger area with ease. Chopped through hard-pack like butter, and slices thumb-sized roots no problem. Update: after several weeks with no rain, tilled part of my front yard with no problems. The ground was hard as a rock. Pro-tip, keep an eye on the cord. A bit of a hastle, but well worth not having the burden of gas/stabilizers/winterizing/oil/engine maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great compact unit
customer_reviews.text: Could not be more pleased with this purchase. We were going to spend about the same money to rent a tiller for the weekend, when we saw this one. Decided to purchase, but really did not have high expectations as we have a ton of clay in our soil. We waited until a day after the rain, while there was a bit of bucking, in general it cut right through and did a great job.
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN FREETH

customer_reviews.title: I like it!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! Admittedly, I only have a couple of small strips to till, but, this thing did it without a hitch. The small strip I did first had a few rocks buried deep down that I didn't know about it and I really didn't have any trouble tilling over them. I certainly wouldn't recommend doing that, but, I didn't know they were there and this tiller didn't care! Did a good job and I was able to get my plants in the ground without a problem. I like it a lot and am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry F.

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for gardeners
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase, works great if you flower gardens or lawns. Using when dry is the best results , when really wet you’ll have mud clumps build up and will have to stop and clean. The handle is well built, the machine is worth having if you are a Gardner instead of renting. Light weight, stores easy as well. It does get deep in the soil and tills well. Will go through small roots from trees nearby. I’ll be out using it soon this coming spring again.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for Raised Beds!
customer_reviews.text: This is a little Powerhorse...Love it! I downsized from a huge vegetable garden & made raised beds closer to the house. This was virgin soil with clay, never been tilled. I used this tiller with wheels down for first 6 inches, added amendments, then raised wheels to deep till. As everyone says, you can till deeper by walking backwards with this. I choose the corded one because I have an outlet nearby. I can do this myself without hubby getting out the monster rear tined Tiller we have.
customer_reviews.author: SueD

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about this machine until I read a review by an older woman. She said that it was great and easy to use. She was right. I decided to buy this tiller because it was so expensive to rent one. I used it to turn over some ground that I was going to sod and it was great. It is very easy to use and turning over the ground was no problem. I am also going to use it to till around our flower beds to keep down weeds. It's a good machine. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: woodworker68

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller !
customer_reviews.text: Man this is a great little tiller especially for the price ! It's worked well to get a large garden started this year with no issues. I was looking at renting one from my local hardware store and this cost about the same for a two day rental so why not just purchase my own ?! Glad I did. I was able to lend it to my parents and sister to use for their garden needs as well.
customer_reviews.author: JVick

customer_reviews.title: Gas till replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my mothers gas tiller and I could not be happier. Not only do you just plug it in and go but it is so powerful. Sometimes the old gas tiller would get bogged down in the small garden and die, this electric tiller just keeps going. ***Will say, watch where the cord is, it doesn't run so great if you till the cord*** but can't blame the tiller for that. They even knew I would do this, the handle is foam and plastic so you cant electrocute yourself if you do run over the cord. Again overall great would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Babcock

customer_reviews.title: Excellent AND low cost.
customer_reviews.text: We have a small garden, but its big enough to be difficult to turn with a shovel. After reading many reviews about electric tillers, the Earthwise was chosen on features, with the bonus of also being low cost. It is also small enough to breakdown and store easily in our limited garage. It worked great. We have lots of stones and roots from pine trees. The speed of the tynes was very fast and cut right through the roots and displaced most small rocks. The "bucking" that people have mentioned is actually quite useful in helping break up hard soil. Overall, excellent value and cannot imagine how it could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless if the ground is dry and hard
customer_reviews.text: Did not work on the ground is dry. All it did was spin up the surface dust. The weeds stuck in the drive shaft
customer_reviews.author: Oceaner

customer_reviews.title: Very durrable
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to buy an electric and small tiller I have had a bigger gas tiller before but the area we were going to garden is 3 small garden areas and 2 strips along a fence line, we live along a river very rocky ground and these areas have never been tilled, new gardens, I'm not going to say it was easy at first but this tiller really did the job. I worked this tiller hard for 2 solid hours never over heated only got a rock stuck once, I worked this unit pretty hard for over 10 hours in the 30 day return period and no issues cleaned it up good and it's ready for fall
customer_reviews.author: Mark D

customer_reviews.title: Good for clay and gentle on the user.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my knees will not take spading the 50 sq ft garden in the spring anymore. It handled breaking up the hard high clay content soil quite well with a minimum of the "bucking" that goes with light weight tillers. As far as some reviewers commenting about no oil in the gear case, it has break-in gear grease on the gears and is supposed to be used "as is" to polish in the gear teeth for 2 years before adding any oil. Read the manual guys - LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Charles V. Holm

customer_reviews.title: Best gardening tool since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: GREAT for my budget & did more than I thought it would do. Tore through everything I threw at it, including buried tree roots that were 2 inches thick in diameter. Sliced right through them. Can dig down about 6 inches but after that if you leave it in the same spot it just keeps digging! lol It'll bury itself in a hole. Oh and the blades are metal, yet the tiller is pretty lightweight... I'm 135 lb female. This machine runs like butter on a 100ft. 14 gauge outdoor extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: My hubby decided on this instead of the gas powered like we already have bc it some times doesn't work from season to season. He said tis works so much better & really digs into the dirt while being very easy to handle. He said he widhes he would have gotten it long before, says it's definitely wort the price, Happy garening!
customer_reviews.author: Amy  51

customer_reviews.title: Works well but difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.text: The roots of the crawling grass used in this area get tangled in the rotating tines. The tiller must be cleaned often and it is difficult to pull the roots out of the tines. If the tines had sharp edges to cut the roots or a different type of tine was available for cutting the roots before tilling it would make the job much easier.
customer_reviews.author: anbra

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This little tiller surprise the crap outta me. The 8.5volt works awesome and makes pretty quick work of a garden. It can even pull up roots no problem and if its to big it just stops turning and unwraps really easy when it gets tangled up. You dont have to worry if your gas tiller is going to work this season or not. Just plug it in and go. Only thing i didn't like was the safety switch which you have to hold down with the handle during operation. My hand starts hurting after awhile. Would prefer a on off switch but sometimes safety should be first because it is really powerful. It is also way way quite
customer_reviews.author: stacy weaver

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Used it for the first time today after work to prepare our small garden patch. Dug right through soil that had been compacted after an Iowa winter. Next up, some new flower beds for the wife. ... I will let the pictures speak for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Don Wills

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye gas tiller!!
customer_reviews.text: I went from a 2 cycle tiller to this and WOW!! Plug it in and go. No more pulling the rope 20 times, no more mixing gas, no more cussing! This little dude has good torque and at times would out run me in the garden. I'll just have to be careful to not till the electric cord. My photos show GA clay after about 3 minutes of tilling. I am very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: GANNP

customer_reviews.title: Machine from heaven
customer_reviews.text: Rarely write reviews but this is deserving. Easy to assemble and easier to use. At 66 I needed something that wasn't a cranky gas powered engine, to churn up and help me move soil so drainage could be improved. I've used a gas tiller before and thought I'd need my teeth replaced after using it. This machine is easy to use for anyone, digs deep and doesn't buck in regular soils. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Csomethingsaysomething

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This product is very lightweight, which given the nature of the product, is a blessing and a curse. Getting it to its location is great and easy but once the blades start spinning it will make its self jump up. On this Texas soil this is an issue. I was able to remove the top layer of grass so that I could put down an above ground garden but if I wanted to till into the dirt I would be best off using a much larger machine or even a manual tool. This is not a heavy duty tool.
customer_reviews.author: FeignedBlade

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected and more versatile than my gas power tiller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I was tired of troubleshooting my gas powered tiller. When I first used this electric tiller I was impressed with the performance and how much easier it was to use because it was so much lighter that my gas powered one. This was perfect for what I needed it for which was to terrace my hill after I installed a retaining wall. If you are working on a hill this worked for me!
customer_reviews.author: trd808

customer_reviews.title: This is a SMALL garden tiller but SOLID!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had gas and aside from the cord being in way occasionally I LOVE THIS TILLER!!!! Super light super powerful “for the size” I got this bcuz I couldn’t swing $100 plus for the next size up and I’m glad I did! This gets right between the rows, chews grass, and sandy loam no problem at all! Clay was a little hard on it if you have lots of clay get the bigger model!
customer_reviews.author: Konalexi

customer_reviews.title: Definately worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Its fairly eady to assemble. The only thing I've had issues with is if there are too many tall weeds it will muck up the tire and over heat. Also when you have to pull it back twards you can be a little difficult. I have muscle issues and found it was easy to use for the most part. Definately weed the big plants first before using. But saved me a lot of time and kept me from having to bed over a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie w

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly powerful tiller!
customer_reviews.text: Bought last October and used for the 1st time yesterday on clay & rock area to start a garden! AMAZED at this little electric tiller "tore it up"! Very impressed. My garden pitch fork barely touched it! Was able to mix peat moss and miracle grow potting soil to make an area to grow some vegetables! Highly recommend for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Flyboy555

customer_reviews.title: Great tool and almost unstoppable
customer_reviews.text: Second one of these I have had (first one broke and it was my fault). This is abgreat tool ... just buy it. It is lightweight but does angreat job around the house if 6 inches or so is the planned tilling depth.
customer_reviews.author: Officer999

customer_reviews.title: Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: This a great garden tool! I am a 65 year old woman and I was able to handle it just fine, even though it is a powerful workhorse. My boyfriend could not believe what a great job it did. It really dug down deep! I love it. Since getting this, I am thinking of expanding my garden.
customer_reviews.author: queenbee

customer_reviews.title: One GREAT Tiller
customer_reviews.text: This tiller assembled easily. Instructions are super simple. We had no problem picking it up to place it into and out of my flower bed. If you have any doubt that the 8.5-Amp isn't enough power, well, it is. This tiller did a wonderful job preparing my soil for planting. It's easy enough to maneuver around my roses, a small spruce tree and other plantings without disturbing their roots. I still have the grooming to do, but you can see from the picture it did a great job. In my opinion, this is a GREAT tiller for a small garden or any planting bed. We're very happy with this purchase and we'll have no problems recommending it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Better alternative for me than a gas powered tiller
customer_reviews.text: My gas tiller died after about 10 years. I didn't want to spring for the extra money and care that a gas model needs... and I was concerned about this thing being heavy and strong enough to do the job. No worries, it works just as well as the gas job, but is quieter and less stinky! I can also store it inside indefinitely without worrying if it'll start the next time I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Avoided reviewing immediately after purchase, since it was at endd-of-season with just one use. Since we’re beyond initial use, we can safely say that this was a great purchase. Build quality is very good. Assembly easy. We’re glad we chose a tiller with wheels, since it’s easy to move to its use site, and pivoting on the wheels allows precise tilling depth and quick withdrawal from hitting roots and rocks. This machine is certainly not for the heavy duty farmer, but great for our typical suburban use. The price for value was great.
customer_reviews.author: John Mac

customer_reviews.title: Stronger than I thought it would be!
customer_reviews.text: I have extensive gardens and I garden for other people as a side job. We have a lot of hard, rocky, clay soil in my area. I was really surprised to find this little machine goes through the clay like a champ. It is light enough for me to pick up with one hand to put in my truck. Small size lets me dig a hole with it in between other plants or blend soil amendments. The electric power means I don't have to mess with gas and oil. A great investment for a great price. Highly recommend for the active gardener.
customer_reviews.author: S. Janczak

customer_reviews.title: In love!!!! Tough easy assembly and quiet
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE*** love this I have attached some pictures. It does a great job and I am still fighting the crab/cow grass such a pain. It this little machine was amazing!! I have hard clay by the way and this machine was not fazed by it. Omg!!!! This little machine is amazing!! I live on the border in New Mexico and I am on old farm land that is not clay. This machine went right throu it and was super easy to put together. It did better then the $80 rental and way quieter. I'll post photos soon
customer_reviews.author: Cussin Irish

customer_reviews.title: Makes flower gardening a whole lot easier.
customer_reviews.text: Finally a compact tiller for our compact flower garden. I guess I always envisioned tillers as these big clunky machines that would be major overkill for the size of our flower garden. We should have gotten one of these a long time ago. It sure makes quick work of getting the garden in shape for the summer and our Minnesota winters. It runs like a top. Plug it and have at it. Chews up the dirt and leaves it so that a quick raking has it ready to go in no time. Impressive.
customer_reviews.author: PJ O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: great item for small gardens
customer_reviews.text: review for Earthwise TC70001 11-Inch 8.5-Volt Corded Electric Tiller/Cultivator wow i was impressed. i got it today and it took maybe 10 minutes to assemble. went out to my open field and tilled an area 25'x25' for my garden. was pleasantly surprised an the ease and power of this machine. if you have a small garden any need something small but powerful this is the item to buy.
customer_reviews.author: B. D. Young

customer_reviews.title: Tough and tiny beast.
customer_reviews.text: Got it today and had it working breaking up the lawn for my garden grow boxes today. Chewed right threw the tough weed patches and tossed rocks aside easily. For such a tiny thing it is a beast! The wiggle factor is extreme and it caused the cord to come undone several times so that is my only complaint but will tape it together next time so the vibrations don't pull it apart again. Made quick work of what would have otherwise been several days and painful recovery to existing injuries. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical, but this is a great tiller.
customer_reviews.text: At this price, I wasn't expecting it to be so effective. It's powerful and seems well made. Helped me till up my entire lawn in no time, work in lime and all. Easy to clean up. Assembly is required, but it was quite easy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Backyard gardeners look no further, this is all you need.
customer_reviews.text: After trying and using a gas tiller I thought "Surely there is an electric one which won't jerk my arm off and make me lightheaded with fumes?!" Furthermore, I wanted something I could lift. I also needed something that could pass the spouse and children test, simple to operate. This unit is so powerful and yet so easy to manage. I worried it wouldn't be enough power for Georgia red clay and rocky soil. I was wrong, it has power to spare. in addition to that assembly was a breeze and cleaning this unit is hassle free. This is a sturdy well constructed and powerful too.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Sibley

customer_reviews.title: Very good machine for the price. More capable than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for a quick job in the front yard. There were a lot of larger rocks it had to get through at times. This machine kept working no matter what I threw at it. For $100 I couldn't be more than happy with this. I used the machine to dig out the entire edge of the mulch bed. You can see the land has a lot of rocks underneath to get through. It did take a beating but I'm sure it will tackle a bunch more projects around the house when I am ready.
customer_reviews.author: Marc S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tiller For Small Gardens
customer_reviews.text: This tiller is incredibly powerful. I had no problem tilling my flower gardens and it did a great job. It jumps around a lot, but that's because the ground has a lot of clay in it. But it did the job. I don't know if I would recommend it for a big garden since it is electric. Hauling around a bunch of extension cords might become more of a problem than it's worth. But overall, it did a great job!
customer_reviews.author: JGB

customer_reviews.title: worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: My husband used this to till the ground for pool leveling. This saved him weeks worth of work in just a short period of time. REVIEW: easy to use, easy to assemble, lightweight and a powerful for its size. Watch the youtube video of a woman and her son tilling for garden. That is what helped my husband decide on purchasing this brand and model versus the in store products.
customer_reviews.author: cyn mcgrath N.

customer_reviews.title: Earthwise Cultivated it's way into my heart! A true back saver!
customer_reviews.text: My first time using an electric cultivator/Tiller, and I couldn't be more pleased! Simple to put together with included instructions. (rather self explanatory) Easy to operate and handle. I feel it's so easy to use, I put my fiance on it who has never used any sort of electric or gas garden tools or machines and she handled it with ease! It's been great to use so far! I'm very happy and pleased with my purchase! For the price, I honestly do not believe you will find a better Cultivator/Tiller! Just keep track of your cord at all times!
customer_reviews.author: J. Lasiter

customer_reviews.title: Buy It, No Regrets!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I didn't expect much from this little tiller despite the reviews. Honestly, this is probably the best purchase I've ever made on Amazon. I am so happy with this tiller that I have recommended it to everyone I've talked to about gardening. I'm only into my second year of gardening and am confident enough in this tiller to double the size of my garden next year. Word of warning, it is light and will jump around...also climbs a fence faster than a squirrel being chased by the dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Mindi

customer_reviews.title: You're going to spend some time putting this together
customer_reviews.text: I came on here to ask a question how hard is it to put together because I work 7 days a week and I don't have much time someone answered someone else and says all you have to do is put the handle together and it takes less than 5 minutes the videos and the pictures clearly show the wheels are off the whole thing has to be put together
customer_reviews.author: filmplanet

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Lightweight Tiller
customer_reviews.text: I have always used gas powered tillers but this one works very well for small spaces. If you have a small garden or flowerbed this tiller will do the job. The only problem I have is that the tiller is very lightweight. Iif you hit a root or large rock it will pull forward very quickly, I've had to get it untangled from my fence two times so far. Be sure to get a good grip on this tiller, it has a lot of power. I've tilled garden beds, flower beds and virgin clay soil with ease. I would recommend this to anyone who doesn't want to deal with a traditional tiller, just be careful around fences.
customer_reviews.author: William D.

customer_reviews.title: Mightly mite, mighty light, nightly durable
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Seven years young and keeps on ripping! Used wisely it will save you considerable labor. It won't do what my 51 year old troy built iron horse will, yet exceeds my expectations after every use. Keep the tines clear of wrap arounds-thin roots, string and stuff taking note of the temp of the gear box. If gear box is hot you are working it too hard. Pulling it works far better than going forward. Great for working mulch into previously tilled areas. Post planting it severs as fabulous electric hoe.It is light and easily lifted into raised beds and vehicles. Has survived loans to several less than experienced gardeners. I highly recommend this machine for all gardeners.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Lapa

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good
customer_reviews.text: Just know that this is not a 60", 500 horsepower, 3-point accessory for your tractor. Forward tilling is just ok, pulling it backward digs better. Light weight. The electrical cord aspect is a pain, but far better than anything gas. If they ever invent a good battery that lasts, this would be an A-1 candidate.
customer_reviews.author: gardener

customer_reviews.title: Oh so quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I've used a small gas powered tiller for years and it finally bit the dust. I ordered this one because of the good reviews and the price was right. I was a little wary when I received it in parts needing assembly, but got it figured out quickly, found an extension cord and was turning my garden beds in no time. It takes a little getting used to having a cord trailing behind and it really does get in the way when tilling small spaces, but I think the tradeoff of having a very quiet machine that is reliable and doesn't need too much maintenance is one I'm happy to have made.
customer_reviews.author: abracadabra

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tiller
customer_reviews.text: It is amazingly powerful for such a small Rototiller. Exceeded my expectations. Probably might have problems starting from grass and hard pan but still very functional. Recommend for any senior that needs lightweight and easy to use. Starting button odd but you get use to it, when it starts you are going so be ready.
customer_reviews.author: jim s

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse with lots of power.
customer_reviews.text: Great for close to the house - within the length of an electric power cord - which meets my needs. No messing with internal combustion fluids and cantankerous starting. Relatively quiet operation. Live in a mountainous area with lots of rocks & stones, which it kicks out - or you can easily pause (tiller uses a dead-man switch) - and dig them out manually. Would be nice to have some variety of speed, but it is a one speed electric so it is either full On or Off.
customer_reviews.author: Hayseed

customer_reviews.title: Aggressive Cuiltivator! Please Help
customer_reviews.text: I love this cultivator. I wish it had two speeds, as it is very aggressive and difficult to handle in hard rocky soil, but it sure gets the job done. Update, 4/11/2017 I was using my cultivator this morning for some severe duty. It broke, and I now have need to order some small parts. I am sure they are not under warrantee, and am willing to purchase them. This product was manufactured for The Great States Corporation, Shelbyville, Indiana. However I cannot find a way to connect with them, or the unknown manufacturer. Any assistance would be greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Williamson

customer_reviews.title: best parts: moves rocks to surface cuts roots up ...
customer_reviews.text: have used it for small patches totaling 1000 sq ft of lawn reseeding. best parts: moves rocks to surface cuts roots up to 1/2" works best by lifting off wheels and going backwards amazingly sturdy for its size and light weight quiet easy to clean with water hose not-best parts: wraps longer roots, etc. around cutting moving parts cord restraint could be better designed push safety switch should be removable by purchaser had to replace handle wing nuts with real bolts and nuts
customer_reviews.author: DDLB

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller jobs
customer_reviews.text: Husband really likes it for what it does: cultivate previously cultivated areas of our big garden. It is easy to handle and does what we need it to. For big jobs he pulls out our big tiller. But he loves this guy for smaller jobs.
customer_reviews.author: C.M.M.

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Best darn little roto-tiller. I didn’t think it would work very well until I used it. I have hard clay soil, and this machine tilled my 600 square foot front yard in 20 minutes. Had new grass seed planted the same morning. Worth the investment, and saved my back.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H.

customer_reviews.title: This made easy work of getting the beds ready for planting
customer_reviews.text: This little rototiller was exactly what I needed to take care of my raised beds. I always put a cover crop in over the winter, chop it down by hand in late winter and then would use a hoe to turn the entire garden over in the Spring. This made easy work of getting the beds ready for planting. Plenty of "oomph" for my needs; was super easy to put together, easy to maneuver to the garden and move from raised bed to raised bed. Would recommend this tiller for anyone needing to till small spaces and looking for something light enough for even a senior to use. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen H.

customer_reviews.title: Great ...love it!
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it, it worked great. It was a tomato garden not tilled in years it went right through the soil end of May that was my first run. I put it away in the garage pulled it out today doesn't start, tried everything I could possibly do, it doesn't start I'm so disappointed I could cry, then I called the lady on the phone was so patient and talked me thru it it was my fault, I wasn't doing it right, now I love it it works great can't wait to fire it up in a few months again
customer_reviews.author: E. Lupi

customer_reviews.title: It's a keeper!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my best purchases. What a time saver! I have centipede grass which tends to get so thick it won't allow nutrients to get to the roots. By shovel it took hours to break up a small area. With this little machine I was done in 15 minutes!! Definitely a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: dw

customer_reviews.title: Needs a Heavy Duty (expensive) extension cord
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this once, so I don't feel comfortable really reviewing it yet. I just wanted to let people know that the only extension cord I found at Home Depot that fit the requirements specified in the owner's manual was $50 for a 50 foot cord. I think the 100 ft cord was $90. I bought this tiller partly because of the low price, and was pretty peeved that I had to pay an additional 50% of it's purchase price just to be able to run it. (Maybe you can find a better deal if you shop around, I needed it right away).
customer_reviews.author: Catty

customer_reviews.title: Great tool and manuverable.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tiller. I am a 5' 2'' semi-strong woman and had no issues maneuvering it around. I live in the southwest with hard, rocky soil. This really helped make the job of tilling for my garden beds a lot easier. I highly recommend wetting the area down for deeper tilling. It jumped a bit when it hit hard areas or rocks, but it also moved them to the sides for easy pick up.
customer_reviews.author: Old Mesquite Workshop

customer_reviews.title: Good things come in small packages.
customer_reviews.text: Great, fantastic and awesome product!!! When it arrived the handle was badly gouged. and called Earthwise, who immediately sent a new one. Great customer service!!!!!!!!! Only one big problem: it took me 3 months to use the tiller due to rain since March 1, 2017, in upstate New York. Was amazed at the speed and strenght of this ltiny electric engine!!!!! It blew my old gas-powered Mantis tiller, out of the water. Earthwise, YOU ARE FANTASTC. WIll order your products again and again. One very peased customer.
customer_reviews.author: arlisa mcgrath

customer_reviews.title: Earthwise TC70001
customer_reviews.text: I love this tiller. I have tilled almost 5000 square ft of a substandard lawn in order to start over. My dirt was packed in hard like it was concrete. The tiller has performed very well with a lot of power and has tilled through some very hard packed soil. Some of the soil I had to turn over or loosen up areas with a shovel first because it was so hard packed. But after that the TC70001 took over and tore the dirt to smithereens. New grass seed is growing nicely now. If you are a do-it-yourself type person, this tool will save you a lot of money. I would not hesitate to recommend this rototiller.
customer_reviews.author: south777seas

customer_reviews.title: Top 5 purchases this year!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tiller! I've used it in my garden and to help loosen soil in the yard (compacted clay), and it worked like a champ. It's a light duty machine, but I think I've pushed it pretty hard. The only time I've experienced issues is in areas with a lot of medium to thick roots. It's also very convenient to use...just plug it in and go (and avoid sucking up the extension cord into the tines, which I did on the day it arrived). Very happy--one of my favorite purchases of the year.
customer_reviews.author: NPOGuy

customer_reviews.title: I like this thing
customer_reviews.text: I like this thing. Need to have realistic expectations. I needed something to work up some areas of a previously tilled garden to plant a fall garlic crop. Getting the big tiller going seems like way too much work. This was perfect for thee job. At that there were some damp compacted areas that brought it to a halt. Give it 30 seconds to cool a bit, go a little shallower and then work it down and no problem. For those that were disappointed that it couldn't till an entire clay yard for initial or major reseeding. Really, there is no free lunch or fairy godmother. This is a very nice "little" electric for appropriate "little" electric tiller jobs.
customer_reviews.author: William Brannon

customer_reviews.title: Bolts holding the tiller assembly broke after first hour of operation
customer_reviews.text: To say that I was very pleased with the performance of this cultivator is an understatement... for the first hour of use, that is. It was at this point that two of the 4 bolts holding the tine assembly sheared off. Despite this sure sign of a fundamental design flaw, I will still ask for replacement rather than refund. It performed superbly while it worked, churning through clay and handling rocks nicely. I will replace the bolts with stronger ones before using the replacement. And if it breaks again, back it goes, and for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!! Hold on. Was not expecting ...
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!! Hold on. Was not expecting the power this has.Broke new ground in my back yard for a garden. Don't get me wrong, I am not saying this tiller replaces a gas tiller.It would have taken me a lot less time to break ground and to prepare my garden with a full size gas tiller. It would have cost me a few hundred more dollars more also if I had went the gas route. This thing will buck and almost snatch out of your hands if you catch a root, but it will not bog down and just keeps powering through. If you are wanting a small garden or using this in flower beds, this deserves serious consideration.
customer_reviews.author: JANA

customer_reviews.title: Very affordable work horse.
customer_reviews.text: This is very rugged machine, not a toy. Used it to loosen ground that had been packed hard under a children's play area covered with landscape cloth and rubber filler. May be a bit stout for weaker individuals, but would probably be manageable for most. Great buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ken in KS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use Easy to put together excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and assemble. Not heavy however it has wheels so that kind of negates that issue but worked like a charm for the 13 x 6 ft space I needed to dig up very pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: mom2

customer_reviews.title: Missing a peice or instructions outdated
customer_reviews.text: It works wonderfully and is plenty strong for my small backyard. I could not however attach the starter to it like in the photo and it seemed like there was a piece missing. I didn't have any part that looked like the one in the manual.
customer_reviews.author: sjohnson

customer_reviews.title: Impressed so far, and one suggestion
customer_reviews.text: So far this seems to work really well. I am very happy with how well it digs in to the ground and handles the rocks of northern New England soil. You really have to hold on to it, as it will bounce around when going over/through the rocks. One suggestion - it is awkward to have to hold the cord with one hand to keep it out of the way and then negotiate the safety button with the pinky of the other hand while trying to hold on the the bucking unit! Perhaps an easier placement of the safety switch?
customer_reviews.author: looneymoose

product_meta.title: Earthwise TC70001 11-Inch 8.5-Amp Corded Electric Tiller/Cultivator
product_meta.description:
Size:11-Inch"

FEATURES:
 * Slim and Lightweight
 * Easy to operate and convenient to store
 * Easy Assembly
 * 8.5 Amp
 * 8"" cutting depth
 * Easy Start

SAFETY FEATURES
 * Power on/off Lever
 * Power cord retention hook

The Earthwise Corded 8.5-Amp Tiller and Cultivator is a must for completing your garden tool collection. This device will take the difficulty out of tilling your yard in the spring when it is time to plant your garden area. This electric garden tiller has a slim, sleek design that will appeal to your sense of style while providing you quality performance that you can rely on. Because it has such a slim design, this piece will store nicely in your garage taking up only a small amount of space. This machine has dual four-blade steel tines that maximize efficiency in your gardening efforts. The Earthwise 8.5-amp electric tiller cultivator has a convenient cutting width of 11"", with a helpful tilling depth of 8"". This tool will prepare your soil precisely how you want it for planting. This Earthwise Tiller is an excellent way to get your garden going strong by getting your yard ready for the healthy growth you want. Ideal for preparing your garden and flower beds, loosening soil and bed cleanup at the end of the season, this electric tiller and cultivator is designed to make your gardening experience hassle-free and enjoyable. Let the Earthwise Corded 8.5-Amp Tiller and Cultivator take care of the hard work for you. Easy to transport and operate with flip down wheels and lightweight design. With the power on and off safety features this tiller will only run when being operated. Just push the start button and squeeze the lever to get started, once the lever is let go the tiller will power off.

"

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Our brands are committed to a eartth friendlly, non-carbon foot print products and that has not changed since 1895. No fumes, no start up hassle! No spark plugs to foul or engines to clog up. They are good for the environment and your lawn. We provide the quality you need at the price that you want. Check out our product line, we offer the tools you will need to take care of all your lawn, garden, and winter needs. We have spent the last 120 years and we will continue to spend the next 120 years keeping America green.
feature_bullets: Powerful 8. 5-Amp motor for superior power, run-time and durability
Ideal for small to mid-size gardens and flower beds; Works well as a weed control tool
(4) durable steel tines; Cultivates and tills up to 11" wide and 8" deep. No side shield
Lightweight design makes it effortless to operate and store; Single lever switch starts every time
Soft ergonomic grip for comfortable operation; Alternative to gas-powered lawn and garden equipment

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,180 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
